summary: Vanadium, classified under the category of iron, steel, and other metal industries, is a significant element in the context of EU trade and regulatory frameworks. Its nomenclature is established in the customs tariff code, ensuring uniform application of rules concerning the import and export of goods. The provisions relating to vanadium are detailed in an annexed table, which adds clarity to its classification and statistical reporting. Pursuant to the last amendments, specific subdivisions of vanadium are described to facilitate trade. The interpretation of these regulations aims to ensure that all stakeholders apply the appropriate standards, thereby promoting good practices in the market.
